intro: Syngonanthus eburneus, commonly known as the white-flowered ironwood, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to Madagascar. It is a small evergreen shrub characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
